result.execSummary:
The defendant David E Weatherbee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Domestic Violence counseling.
Anger Management course.
No contact with victim except as outlined in the restraining order and/or family court case.
Court will allow out of state travel for work related business.

Restitution to be determined at next hearing on 2/10/2017 at 8:30am

AS OF 2/10/2017: Restitution was ordered in the amount of $2,250.00 (to Lisa W) along with restitution surcharges. To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

ADDRESS INFO for David E Weatherbee
Current: c/o General Deliver, Delafield, WI 53018-9998 United States  (Effective: 02-10-2017)
Prior: 2736 Nagawicka Ave, Delafield, WI 53018 United States
Crime victim restitution form

Defendant David E Weatherbee in court with attorney Michael J Finn.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Suzanne Fischer Lorenz appeared for the victim.  Attorney Finn advises the court the parties have reached a resolution as to the amount of restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $2,250.00 to Lisa W.
Restitution hearing on February 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Three treatment counseling letters

Defendant David E Weatherbee in court with attorney Michael J Finn.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State presents sentencing arguments.  Lisa W. makes statement.  Defense presents sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS JAIL (CREDIT - none); STAYED

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
*No contact with:  victim except as outlined in the restraining order and/or family court case.  
*Domestic Violence counseling
*Anger Management course
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

RESTITUTION:  to be determined (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURCHARGE:  $100.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation).

Court will allow out-of-state travel for work related business.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
12/17/16 Letter from Defendant - Statement of Interests: Notice of Claim to Full Title, Notice of Appointment of Trustee, Notice to Rebut and/or Disclaim Registered Mail # RE331794034US
Notice of Hearing returned
Notice of Bail Bond Forfeiture
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 11, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with witness listed in the Criminal Complaint, except as authorized through the injunction in case #15CV1526.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Defendant David E Weatherbee in court with attorney Michael J Finn.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 09:30 am.
11/21/16 Letter filed by Defendant re: Tolling of Time
Treatment lettter
Filed by Def. dated 11/17/16 re: Notice of Claim to Full Title, Notice of Appointment of Trustee, Notice to Rebut and/or Disclaim
Treatment plan dated 11/16/16

Attorney Michael J Finn in court.  Defendant David E Weatherbee did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was called for scheduling hearing at 11:16 am.  Attorney Finn does not know why defendant did not appear.  State requests capias and revokes and forfeits bail.  Defense makes arguments.  Court issues capias and revokes and forfeits bail.
Letter from Defendant dated 11/12/16
Sentencing hearing on November 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David E Weatherbee in court with attorney Michael J Finn.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Parties stipulate to the disorderly conduct charge.  Only issue being contested is the domestic violence enhancer.  

Witnesses called:  Victim (L.W.), Deputy Tim Loberg (Waukesha County Sheriff's Department).  
All witnesses sworn and testified. 
State rests.

Witness called:  David Weatherbee (defendant).  
Witness sworn and testified.
Defense rests.

Testimony deemed closed.  

State presents closing arguments.   Defense presents closing arguments.  State presents rebuttal.  

Court finds the following:   
  -  Elements of disorderly conduct are clearly present.  
  -  Testimony is clear that defendant was directing his anger at the victim.  Court finds that does rise to the level of imminent danger.  
Therefore, the Court finds defendant guilty of domestic violence including the domestic abuse enhancer.
Further reasons placed on the record.  
  
Defense requests separate sentencing date.  Court sets date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David E Weatherbee in court with attorney Michael J Finn.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are ready to proceed to trial.  Defense requests trial to the Court rather than jury.  State does not object.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding waiver of jury trial.  Court approves jury waiver.  Court to address motions the morning of trial.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.
filed by the state

Due to the court calendar, Court adjourns the matter for a #1 trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Jury status hearing on July 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
